Webcomponents

This is a webcomponents experiment. Read more about about the background and the technologies used as https://github.com/timoschinkel/webcomponents.

Forms

Forms and inputs are a ciritical part of the html specification, and thus of web development.

Form inputs are special. Special is the sense that they are designed to be part of other elements - form and fieldset -, and that as such have a special interaction.

Shadow DOM

Let's first create a simple input element, using shadow DOM.

When submitting the form an alert will show with the contents of FormData of the form. After that the form is submitted using a GET request, so you can see the payload that is submitted in the query parameters.

The result is that the contents of `<input-shadow-dom> is not taken into account. Neither when creating a FormData object, nor when submitting.
